reviews.review_msg: Having seen all the reviews, it's clear that a lot of people get on the wrong side of the prof. This is definitely possible. Her humour is something you'll have to get used to because it's sarcastic and sassy. That being said, show up to class prepared! I did well in her class because of that. People who do poorly usually aren't prepared at all.

Do not take her class - save yourself money and time by watching a history movie yourself because her classes are literally just a recording of her rambling for two hours. She didn't make any effort to engage with her students over Zoom except for the very last day and then acted surprised when nobody was engaged or wanted to participate.

She is a tough grader and the average grades in the course on every assignment were pretty low. Her feedback tended to be pretty nebulous and didn't give much direction on how to improve in the future. I found I didn't learn that much relevant material and I didn't enjoy the assignments. Some people seemed to like her but it wasn't for me.

This class is a joke, just like the prof. She is rude, takes way too long to mark, boring, too much history nothing about GSWS. Marks SO unreasonably. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! She does not care about students. Rambles. I cannot stress how unreasonably she marks. I give this class and prof a hard F! Cancels class cuz she's moving but we paid for it!

She marks so hard and not very fair, she showed us her grading rubric and uses terms such as "meh", thought that was very rude. She is understandable when it comes to deadlines, gives you a "grace period" for due dates which is helpful. But still wouldn't take a class with her again. I wanted to like her but she was not helpful during covid at all.

Her class became more like weird group therapy of students just ranting about things. Each class began with a discussion over readings and it was never helpful but felt very forced to speak as she just stares at you until you do. Her lectures are more history based and not solely focused on GSWS content.
